1.title: Vaishali Kushan and Ayurveda

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

1.plot: The show features Vaishali Kushan. Laura and Vaishai discuss Ayurvedic medicine -- also known as Ayurveda -- which is one of the world's oldest holistic (whole-body) healing systems. It was developed thousands of years ago in India. It is based on the belief that health and wellness depend on a delicate balance between the mind, body, and spirit.

13.title: Letricia Hendrix

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

13.plot: Mario Salvador Jr. interviews Letricia Hendrix about her book "Behind Our Faces: Thoughts and Reasoning of Suicide." Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access TV (FPA), Cox cable channel 10 in Fairfax, Virginia. FPA also airs on Comcast cable in Reston and channel 10 on Verizon FIOS in other counties in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen worldwide through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

14.title: Barra Kahn

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

14.plot: Mario Salvador Jr. interviews Barra Kahn about core energetics and yoga, among other topics. Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access TV (FPA), Cox cable channel 10 in Fairfax, Virginia. FPA also airs on Comcast cable in Reston and channel 10 on Verizon FIOS in other counties in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

15.title: Alex de Colon

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

15.plot: Mario Salvador Jr. chats with his longtime friend, Alex de Colon, composer and musician. Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access TV (FPA), Cox cable channel 10 in Fairfax, Virginia. FPA also airs on Comcast cable in Reston and channel 10 on Verizon FIOS in other counties in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

16.title: Potluck Special WMIFF Awards Pt. 1

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

16.plot: One hour special on the World Music and Independent Film Festival awards ceremony, held on August 21, 2010 at the Capital Hilton in Washington, D.C.

17.title: Dr. Tran Khuu

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

17.plot: Meera Narasimhan interviews Dr. Tran Khuu, chiropractor, who tells of her method of treating patients with NASA developed computerized equipment. No popping, cracking, twisting, or other painful methods involved. Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access TV (FPA), Cox cable channel 10 in Fairfax, Virginia. FPA also airs on Comcast cable in Reston and channel 10 on Verizon FIOS in other counties in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen worldwide through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

18.title: Compass Career

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

18.plot: Host Meera Narasimhan interviews Rebecca Simpson and Jacqueline Rose of Compass Career Strategies who advise people seeking a new career. POTLUCK: the anything and everything talk and entertainment TV show airs on Fairfax Public Access, Channel 10, on Cox Cable, Verizon FIOS, and Comcast in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen worldwide on the Internet through YouTube & VEOH videos.

19.title: Potluck Special WMIFF Awards Pt. 2

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

19.plot: A one-hour Potluck special. Part II of the World Music and Independent Film Festival, taped at the Capital Hilton in Washington DC on August 21, 2010. Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access TV (FPA), Cox cable channel 10 in Fairfax, Virginia. FPA also airs on Comcast cable in Reston and channel 10 on Verizon FIOS in other counties in Northern Virginia. Potluck can also be seen through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

20.title: Holiday 2010

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

20.plot: A funny thing happened on the way to the Potluck Holiday Show 2010! Host Meera Narasimhan with participants Patrick Coffey, Bad Driving Chicken, Tom Fricke, Mario Salvador Jr., and Monster Madhouse's Jerry Moore, Chris Inlow, Christopher Inlow, and Peter Swinburne. Singing by Leonard Greenberg and Adrienne Hope. "Silent Night" sung by Gayle Yiotis. Potluck can be seen on Fairfax Public Access, Channel 10, in Northern Virgnia on Cox Cable, Verizon FIOS, and Comcast. Potluck can also be seen worldwide through the Internet on YouTube and Veoh videos.

1.title: Leland Steigs

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

1.plot: Meera interviews Leland Steigs, producer/director of "Lives and Deaths of the Poets," a farcical comedy about some of our greatest people, famous and infamous and what they didn't do (but could have).

2.title: June Daguiso and WMIFF 2011

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

2.plot: Meera interviews June Daguiso and Monica Smothers about his movie "Collide." Monica is a principal actor in the movie. Juse also talks about his upcoming WMIFF in August 2011.

3.title: Connie Lamothe

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

3.plot: Connie Lamothe talks about her films, Reunion, Rosie's Miracle, and The Driver, her awards, and her future projects.

4.title: Patrick Coffey

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

4.plot: Patrick is a walking encyclopedia when it comes to things he is interested in. Patrick's into 20th century collectibles, primarily 40s, 50s, and 60s, but he can also talk about classic movies and radio and TV shows.

5.title: Oscar Hawkins

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

5.plot: Mario Salvadore, Jr. interviews Oscar Hawkins, dancer/choreographer who was a featured dancer with the Cirque de Soleil, one among his many accomplishments.

6.title: Jason Baustin

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

6.plot: Meera interviews Jason Baustin, an American University graduate and upcoming film producer about his first film, "Gone Forever," which premiered at the AFI Silver Theater in Silver Spring, MD in April 2011.

7.title: Danielle Keith

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

7.plot: Mario Salvador Jr. talks with Danielle Keith, life coach, on Potluck: the anything and everything talk and entertainment TV show. Potluck airs on Fairfax Public Access in Fairfax, Loudoun, and Stafford counties in Virginia, and in Alexandria and Falls Church. FPA can be seen on Channel 10 on Cox cable and Verizon FIOS.

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

9.plot: Meera talks with June about the WMIFF awards ceremony coming up Aug. 20, 2011 at the Capital Hilton in Washington DC. This is the second annual World Music and Independent Film Festival.

10.title: Michael Merino

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

10.plot: Guest host, Laura Hartmann, talks with Michael Merino, producer/director, Nadia Williams, actor, and Regen Wilson, actor, about their latest film "The Haunting of Pearson Place."

11.title: Dionne Audain

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

11.plot: Meera interviews actor Dionne Audain who appeared in film and on TV. She talks about her forthcoming book and films such as "Salt" and "Toe to Toe" and TV shows such as "All My Children," "The Wire," and "Law and Order," among others

12.title: Scott Mathias

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

12.plot: Potluck interviews Scott Mathias and Shane McClung, producers and directors of "The Fellows Hip: Rise of the Gamers," a film that pays homage to Tolkien and "Lord of the Rings". Shot with a red camera, with full approval of the Tolkien copyright holders, this is a film to watch.

13.title: Edward Colon

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

13.plot: On our first show in November Mario Salvador Jr. interviews Edward Colon, Senior Scientific Programmer at the National Center for Environmental Prediction (NCEP)/Environmental Modeling Center (EMC). It's all about the weather folks! Tune in for this enlightening and interesting discussion on predicting the weather and why meteorologists get it wrong (dare I say much of the time? or at least some of the time?). Also, climate control, global warming, and what? Star Trek!

14.title: John Johnson

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

14.plot: Meera interviews John Johnson, CEO of Darkstone Entertainment about his latest film Plan 9. Johnson is an award-winning and Emmy nominated filmmaker and writer who has completed 99 films, including 24 features, 7 of which are in distribution around the world.

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

11.title: The Actual Dance

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

11.plot: The Actual Dance is a play written and performed by Sam Simon and directed by Jessie Roberts. It is a dramatic exploration of the emotional and spiritual journey of confronting the possibility of being with the person you have loved most in the world through the end of life. In the spring of 2000, Sam's wife Susan was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. That diagnosis and subsequent treatments took both of them on a roller coaster ride that moved from elation to despair and back again. The Actual Dance is a presentation of that ride from Sam's perspective.

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

In the spring of 2000, Sam's wife Susan was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. "Joy to the World" and "Away in the Manger," the opening and closing music, is performed by the U.S. Marine Band Corps and in the Public Domain.

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

14.plot: Holiday 2013 Pt II has a potpourri of entertainment. Singers from the United Methodist Galilee Church in Sterling, Virginia, two dancers from Project C Dance studio in Westminster, Maryland. And of course, we have Santa Claus. We also have interlude singers, the Vienna Theatre Singing Group.

2.title: Friends of Homeless Animals

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

2.plot: Lajura Hartman interviews two volunteers from Friends of Homeless Animals (FOHA), a no-kill shelter in northern Virginia.

3.title: Jason Mendelson & the MetroSongs Orchestra

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

3.plot: Potluck presents Jason Mendelson accompanied by his 12 piece MetroSongs orchestra. They play several original compositions about the DC area.

4.title: Sandra Taylor, the Gift Maker

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

4.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Sandra Taylor, the Gift Maker, who talks about and displays some of her soap creations. Potluck the Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV show airs on Fairfax Public Access TV in Fairfax Virginia.

5.title: Star FK Radium

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: The Hater Nation

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

6.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Michael McNutt, Byron Whitaker, and Yamah Tabibi, radio hosts of The Hater Nation. (thehaternationshow.com)

7.title: Jonny Grave & Terry Boes

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

7.plot: Jonny Grave on guitar and Terry Boes on harmonica play and sing some mean blues. Hosted by Laura Hartman.

8.title: Jas Boothe

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

8.plot: Laura interviews Jas Boothe, U.S. Army veteran, who speaks about two projects in which she is heavily involved, Final Salute Inc., it's mission is to provide homeless women veterans with safe and suitable housing, and the Ms. Veteran America event, it's purpose is to showcase The Woman Beyond the Uniform.

9.title: Frank Giglio Audiophile

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

9.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Frank Giglio, audiophile who discusses why audiophiles still collect and listen to records and albums in lieu of CDs and digital music.

10.title: Bertocci and Guiducci

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

10.plot: Laura interviews Tori Bertocci and Pasquale Guiducci, co-founders of relEASE, a physical theatre company based in the greater Washington DC area. relEASE focuses on telling the stories of the human condition through various forms of art and expression.

11.title: Providence Players

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

11.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Chip Gertzog, Don Myers, Liz Mykietyn, and Andra Whitt from the Providence Players about their upcoming play Rumors.

12.title: Curvy Chix Chariot

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

12.plot: Laura interviews Donna Hundley owner/founder of Curvy Chix Chariot. Donna caters to plus size women. Donna brought with her four models, Sybil Baker, Monica McKenzie, Samichie Thomas, and Shirayne Thompson who will model some of Donna's fashions.

13.title: Empty Shelter Project

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

13.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Rachel Gilbert, Tara Mattson, and Amber Taylor from the Empty Shelter Project, a rescue organization for homeless and abused dogs (espnova.org). Kudos to these three for their wonderful work with these precious treasures.

14.title: Bel Cantanti Opera

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

14.plot: Laura interviews Katerina Souvorova, Emma Gorin, Rob McGinness, Julia Park, and Jake Stamatis from the Bel Cantanti Opera House in Silver Spring, MD.

15.title: Marlee in the Mixx

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

15.plot: The first show in August brings an interview with Ellis Lambert, founder of 3D Music Group, and Marlee D, Foots (Bradley McDonald), and Rob Lowe of Marlee in the Mixx.

16.title: Azurae Windwalker

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

16.plot: Laura interviews Azurae Windwalker of the Amethyst Center in Virginia.

17.title: Vienna Theatre Company

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

17.plot: The Vienna Theatre Company in Vienna Virginia presents "A Thurber Carnival" in October. Laura Hartman interviews Jessie Roberts, Judy Butler, Pamela Kasenetz, and Steven Palkovitz about "A Thurber Carnival," a play by James Thurber.

18.title: Fairfax Station Railroad Museum

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

18.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Michael Chinworth, vice president of the Fairfax Station Railroad Museum, and John Murphy, Phil Scruggs, and Jon Vrana, volunteers and re-enactors from the Fairfax Station Railroad Museum.

19.title: Byrdies Buddies

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

19.plot: Laura interviews Peyton Jensen (and her best friend Byrdie), founder of Byrdie's Buddies, a non-profit corporation dedicated to bettering and saving the lives of animals. Unlike other corporations, Byrdie's Buddies partners with local pet supply companies to deliver food and supplies to animals in need.

20.title: Daniela Badillo

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

20.plot: The 2014 Potluck Holiday Show Part I features Daniela Badillo, an aspiring singer from Ecuador. Kudos to Daniela for stepping in at the last minute due to a cancellation. Daniela had about a week to prepare! She's a real trooper!

21.title: TV Potluck Holiday 2014 II

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

21.plot: Holiday 2014 Part II features dancers from the Creative Dance Center of Virginia.

1.title: Rahmein Mostafavi

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

1.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Rahmein Mostafavi, a local stand up comedian.

2.title: Bianca and Michael Alexander "Conscious Living"

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

2.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Michael and Bianca Alexander on living a better, healthier, life style. They call it "Conscious Living."

3.title: Creative Dance World Dance Competition

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

3.plot: Features Creative Dance Center dances from the World Dance Competition.

4.title: Max Mazzim

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

4.plot: Features Max Mazzim, singer, and guests.

5.title: Other Desert Cities

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

5.plot: Director, Rosemary Hartman and three of the actors discuss their upcoming play, Other Desert Cities.

6.title: Bill Grella

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

6.plot: Bill Grella travels around the country to restaurants featured in the TV show, "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives," and discusses them on his blog.

7.title: Carol Collins

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

7.plot: Potluck host Laura Hartman interviews Carol Collins, family entertainer over 35 years (Bingo the clown, Safari Bingo with live animals, Mrs.Claus, Mother Christmas, Easter Bunny, Comedy grams) Owner of talent booking agency for over 50 variety acts.

8.title: Dante Baker

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

8.plot: Laura interviews Dante Baker owner, personal trainer, Qi gong teacher, and massage therapist, who will also play beautiful, serene music on Chinese bowls.

9.title: Aradia Fitness

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

9.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Melissa Rose, owner of Aradia Fitness. With Melissa are Katherine Gorden, Beth Leonard, Monique Roach, and Stephanie Shultzaberger. They discuss how pole dancing can be a good exercise and lots of fun!

10.title: Alan Cornfield

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

10.plot: Laura interviews Dr. Alan Cornfield, a long time chiropractor who has several practices in Maryland. Dr. Cornfield discusses the health benefits of seeing a chiropractor, and how his practice works in tandem with other disciplines such as acupuncture and neurology.

11.title: Warrior Buddies

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

11.plot: Laura Hartman interviews the president of the Humane Society, Lori Leary. about the Warrior Buddies Program sponsored through the Prince William Humane Society. With her are two trainers from "Sit Means Sit." Sonny and Melissa Madsen.

12.title: The Lonesome Trail

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

12.plot: Laura Hartman interviews director, writer, and producer of The Lonesome Trail feature film Arlette Thomas-Fletcher. With her are actors, Lamont Easter, Kelly Schwartz, and Colin McHugh.

13.title: Lamont Easter

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

13.plot: Laura interviews Lamont Easter about his acting career and how he got started, sort of accidentally, and the charity work that followed.

14.title: Jas Boothe II

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

14.plot: Laura interviews Jas Boothe about her new book, The Princess and the Pedophile.

15.title: Rosemary Hartman and Tom Epps

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

15.plot: Laura Hartman, Potluck host, interviews Rosemary Hartman and Tom Epps of the Vienna Theatre Company about their upcoming plays.

16.title: Ritzya

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

16.plot: Laura Hartman interviews Ritzya, the Smile Coach, who tells how she got named that.

17.title: Carol Collins & Miguel Flores

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

17.plot: Carol Collins visits again with her hedgehog, who likes to sleep, and hamsters who may or may not like to race. With her is Miguel Flores who wears many hats.

18.title: Holiday 2015 Part I Nutcracker in a Shell

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

18.plot: Our first show features dancers from the Creative Dance Center of Ashburn, South Riding, and Chantilly, and host Laura Hartman interviews Ramona Batchelder, owner of the Creative Dance Center and president of IPAY. The CDC dancers are Ana Gustin, Nelson Meija, Sloan Grant, Lauren Est, Matt Haskett, and Morgan Rominski. Director, Geralyn Ward. Choreographers, Geralyn Ward, Michelle Kudrin, and Aleksey Kudrin. Creative Dance Center.

19.title: Holiday 2015 II Jazz Christmas

episode of.title: Potluck: The Anything and Everything Talk and Entertainment TV Show (TV Series 2008– )

19.plot: The second Holiday 2015 show features Jazz Standards by Stacie and Co. A local DMV jazz troupe featuring Stacie Steinke, vocalist; Reinhardt Liebig, pianist; and Robert Vetter, trumpet. They sing and play standard holiday songs with a twist.
